result.execSummary:
The defendant Lajuan T Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Restitution to be paid to District Attorney's Office to be forwarded to Discover Credit Card. Paid as a condition of sentence, cash bond on file was applied to restitution balance.

Cash bond on file to be applied to costs. Remaining cash bond is to be refunded to the poster.   Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Time served, 10 days credit was granted.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lajuan T Johnson

Letter dated 6/25/19 from employer- Blue Ribbon Fastener Co.

01:35 PM Defendant Lajuan T Johnson in court by zoom with attorney Donna Kuchlar for Anthony D Cotton in person.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin by zoom  The parties agreed to have the hearing conducted remotely under the Standing COVID-19 Order requirements. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing..  Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. Attorney Thurston makes recommendations to the court. Court conducts a plea colloquy with the defendant.  Defendant enters a plea of guilty to count 1. Court finds the defendant guilty of count 1.  Court dismisses and reads in counts 2 and 3.  State makes statements to the court.  Attorney Kuchlar makes statements.  Defendant makes statments.  

The Court Orders the Following to Count 1:

10 Jail  (Credit - 10 days). Time served. 

RESTITUTION:  $ $870.66 to  Discover Credit Card (to be paid as a condition of the sentence - restitution to be paid before costs or fines);

COSTS: $268.00
	
DNA Surcharge: $250.00

DRGOD: $10.00

Cash bail to be applied to restitution, costs or fines. 

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
